intro: Kalidiopsis wagenitzii, commonly known as the Cape Town daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces numerous small florets arranged in a composite head. Kalidiopsis wagenitzii is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
